direction.raw_text: . FOX Nothing. Supposedly, it's just a twenty- four hour bug. He gave me some pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you. You probably just ate some bad gristle. Fox brushes the fur on Mrs. Fox's ears with his paws. They walk together along the crest of the hill to a fork in the path. Fox points:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we take the short cut or the scenic route?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Let's take the short cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the scenic route is so much prettier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (SHRUGS) OK, let's take the scenic route.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. It's actually slightly quicker, anyway. Fox throws his apple core away over his shoulder and dances a quick circle around Mrs. Fox, wrapping his arm around her waist extravagantly and making her laugh as they start off down the scenic route.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A rustic cottage surrounded by a small barn, a tin silo, and a rickity windmill. There is a sheep in a little pasture. A sign on a rail says Berkus Squab. Fox and Mrs. Fox watch from the bushes outside a fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX What is a squab?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what a squab is. It's like a pigeon, I suppose. Anyway, it's a type of bird we can eat. Fox motions toward the edge of the property.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we go through the hole under the horse fence or climb the rail over the bridle path?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Well, I guess the horse fence would be a little safer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the bridle path puts us out right next to the squab shack. Mrs. Fox hesitates. She fiddles with her paws. She nods nervously. She shakes slightly. Fox looks at her funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? I've never seen you like this. You're acting all skittish. Don't worry. I've been stealing birds for a living since before I could trot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (SHRUGS) OK, let's take the -- FOX No, we'll do the horse fence. You gave me the scenic route already. Fox flashes a smile. He says suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, you look unbelievably beautiful tonight. You're practically glowing. Maybe it's the lighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mrs. Fox is, in fact, glowing, albeit ever so slightly. She stares at Fox enigmatically. Fox touches his paw to her cheek. (NOTE: an alternate version of Mrs. Fox will be used for this shot which can be literally lit from within.) With the speed, grace, and precision of athletes, Fox and Mrs. Fox: dart through a hole under a painted fence; race along a thin trail next to a garage; crawl beneath a window where a blonde woman serves an early dinner, dealing hamburgers like playing cards to three little, blond children; creep past a doghouse where a golden retriever sleeps with an airline sleeping mask over his eyes; and shimmy over a doorway outside a workshop where a blond, bearded farmer hacks into a stump with a hatchet, completely pulverizing it into sawdust. They arrive in front of a wooden shed. Fox whistles sharply with a half-chirp and performs a rapid reverse-flip with a flourish. Fox lifts a loose board. He looks to Mrs. Fox and puts his finger to his lips for her to be quiet. She shrugs impatiently. They duck inside. They come back out. Each holds a dead, bloody pigeon in his/her teeth. They start to run away. Fox looks up above them. He stops. He frowns. He takes the pigeon out of his mouth and says curiously, pointing toward the sky:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? I think that's a fox-trap! Look at this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Get away from there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it spring-loaded? Yeah... (pointing to different spots) I guess if you come from over there, and you're standing at the door to the squab shack, this little gadget probably triggers the -- (gesturing to Mrs. Fox) Move out of the way, darling. That's right where it's going to land. Mrs. Fox runs back to Fox and tugs at his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Come on! Stop it! Let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox pulls on a little, hanging wire. A chain unrolls rapidly from a pulley, and a steel cage falls slap down on top of them. A small tag on the base of it says Badoit et Fils. Fox and Mrs. Fox stand motionless, side by side, in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it just falls straight down right here, doesn't it? I guess it's not spring- loaded. Sounds come from around the farm: the dog barks, doors open, voices yell, lights come on. Mrs. Fox turns to Fox and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX I'm pregnant. Fox stares at Mrs. Fox. He is confused but moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. We're going to have a cub. Honey, that's great news!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX If we're still alive tomorrow morning, I want you to find another line of work. Pause. Fox nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wide shot of the entire valley. There are thick woods, green and yellow fields, two ponds, a small village, and a river running through the middle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ( 12 Fox-Years)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The entrance to a tunnel under a dirt mound covered with holly bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A small, comfortable kitchen off a living room with two bedrooms behind it. Fox sits at the kitchen table reading a newspaper called the Gazette. His fur has gone grey at the temples, and he now wears a dark, double-breasted, pin- striped suit with a conservative necktie. Mrs. Fox stands at the counter-top stirring something in a bowl with a whisk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She is dressed in a paint-splattered, cream-colored, Victorian-style dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A column in the newspaper with Fox's picture at the top of it. The caption reads: Fox about Town with Fantastic Mr. Fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does anybody actually read my column? Do your friends ever talk about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (STILL STIRRING) Of course. In fact, Rabbit's ex- girlfriend just said to me last week, "I should read Foxy's column," but they don't get the Gazette. (yelling into the next room) Ash! Let's get cracking!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would they? It's a rag-sheet. (SIGHS) I want to say I hate my job, but that would make it seem more important to me than I want people to think it is. Mrs. Fox puts down her bowl and starts slicing a loaf of bread. A small, narrow fox cub comes out of one of the bedrooms wearing white pants and no shirt. His hair is smashed all onto one side sticking up wrong. He is Ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You're not sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a temperature. Mrs. Fox goes quickly over to Ash and puts her paw to his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You don't have a temperature. Ash turns away and says as he goes back into his bedroom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Hurry up. You're going to be late. Mrs. Fox goes back into the kitchen and starts making toast and coffee. Fox whispers to her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the way you handled that. Mrs. Fox looks at Fox sideways. She says loudly to Ash:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Your cousin Kristofferson's coming first thing tomorrow morning. I want you to be extra nice to him, because he's going through a very hard time right now, OK? Ash comes back out of his bedroom. He now wears a white cardigan and white socks with his white pants tucked into them. He says aggressively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's he going to sleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX We're going to make a bed for him in your room tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't spare the space. Put him in Dad's study. Fox says without looking up from his newspaper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad's study is occupied by Dad. Ash goes back into his bedroom. Fox lowers his newspaper. He looks around the room. He says to Mrs. Fox:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to live in a hole anymore. It makes me feel poor. Mrs. Fox stops buttering the toast. She looks to Fox and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX We are poor -- but we're happy. Fox twists his paw in the air, indicating:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comme-ci, comme-ga. Anyway, the views are better above ground. Mrs. Fox nods. She brings Fox a plate of toast and a cup of coffee. Fox takes her paw and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm seven non-fox-years old now. My father died at seven and a half. I don't want to live in a hole anymore, and I'm going to do something about it. Fox kisses Mrs. Fox's paw. He suddenly eats three slices of toast in a second and a half, savagely but neatly. He stands and picks up his cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm off. Fox throws back the last of his coffee, kisses Mrs. Fox on the back of her neck, grabs his briefcase, tucks his newspaper under his arm, and walks to the door. He shouts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a good day, my darlings! Ash comes out the bedroom again. He has now added a white cape to his ensemble and is in the middle of brushing his teeth. There is toothpaste all over his mouth. He waves briefly to Fox and goes back into his bedroom. Fox looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he wearing? Mrs. Fox shrugs. She smiles sadly and waves to Fox. Fox waves back. He starts to go out but pauses to look down at a folded up section of his newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A clipping from the real estate section. There is a photograph of a wide, sprawling beech tree at the top of a hill. A caption below it reads: Tree Living, Great Views, Classic Beech
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A door opens into a wide, low space with peeling paint. There is an old chair against the wall, a bare light bulb hanging
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . from the ceiling, and a layer of dust over everything. A skinny weasel in a khaki outfit immediately starts in as Fox comes into the living room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously, it's first growth, indigenous. Original dirt floor, good bark, skipping stone hearth -- Weasel is interrupted by a loud banging clank. He and Fox peer into the next room. A heavy-set opossum with a cowlick tinkers with some pipes under the kitchen sink. He is Kylie. Weasel snaps at him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd I tell you? I'm showing the property. You're not supposed to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checking his watch) Oh, cuss. What time is it? I'm sorry. Weasel sighs. He waves his arm in Kylie's direction and says distractedly, slightly annoyed:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Kylie. He's the super. (aside to Fix) He's a little -- Weasel makes a fluttering gesture with his paw. Fox nods. He points at a bucket on the floor next to Kylie among bolts, tools, and washers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in the bucket, Mr. Kylie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just minnows. You want one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly. Thank you. Kylie reaches into his bucket and hands Fox a live, wriggling minnow. Fox swallows it whole. Fox stares out the window at three sprawling poultry compounds in the distance. Black smoke pours out of a farmhouse chimney on each property. A sign on a water tower in the first compound reads Boggis Farms and has a picture of a chicken on it. A sign on a silo in the second compound reads Bunce Industries and has a picture of a goose on it. A sign on a windmill in the third compound reads Bean, inc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (since 1976) and has a picture of a turkey with an apple on it. Weasel says pointedly from across the room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I ask what you do for a living, Mr. Fox? Fox's eyes narrow as he looks out, entranced, with his mouth slightly open. He says almost inaudibly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to steal birds, but now I'm a newspaper man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure. I've seen your by-line. Fox snaps out of his reverie and says suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon, gentlemen. Fox shakes hands abruptly with Weasel and starts across the room. Weasel is about to ask something when Fox stops in the doorway, looks back, and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and Kylie -- thank you for the minnow. It was superb. Kylie smiles. Fox exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A beaver dam across a bend in a fast stream. A still pond sits above it. There is an entrance tunnel tucked beneath a rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A large room of twig, stick, and mud construction. A card on the door reads Badger, Beaver, and Stoat, L.L.P, Attorneys at Law. An anxious badger sits at his desk reviewing some documents. Fox paces the floor with his hands clasped behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't buy this tree, Foxy. You're borrowing at nine and a half, which stinks like cuss, plus moving into the most dangerous neighborhood in the (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: country for someone of your type of species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're exaggerating, Badger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bull-cuss! I'm sugar-coating it, man! This is Boggis, Bunce, and Bean! Three of the meanest, nastiest, ugliest farmers in the history of this valley! An uneasy otter secretary peers in at them from the outer office. Fox looks intrigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Tell me about them. Silence. Badger sighs. He loosens his tie and settles in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fat man with a huge moustache. He wears a tweed suit which stretches at the buttons so much that they look like they are about to snap off. He holds a carbine rifle. He stands in front of his farm, which contains row upon row of chicken houses. He has an ugly face. He is Boggis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Walter Boggis is a chicken farmer. Probably the most successful in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Boggis sits at a chopping block tearing into a boiled chicken with a fork and a meat cleaver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) He's unbelievably fat -- which maybe is genetic -- but he also eats three boiled chickens smothered with dumplings every day for breakfast, lunch, supper, and dessert. That's twelve in total, per diem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Boggis' ear. Furry black and white hairs grow out of it. A fly buzzes around, lands on it, and crawls inside. Boggis sticks his pinky in after it and scratches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) He never takes a bath, as a result of which his ear holes are clogged with all kinds of muck and wax and bits of chewing gum and dead flies and so on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A short, overweight man with one slightly wandering eye. He wears overalls and a cap. He holds a twelve-gauge shotgun. He stands in front of his farm, which consists of several long buildings in rows like a factory. He has a nasty face. He is Bunce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Nathan Bunce is a duck and goosefarmer. He owns about 2 million ducksand 500,000 geese. You might say he's kind ofa pot- bellied dwarf of some kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bunce stands up to his nose in water. The depth reads 4FT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) He's so short his chin would probably be under water in the shallow end of any swimming pool on the planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bunce sits on two stacked telephone books on a chair. He guts a dead goose, cutting out its liver and mashing it with a fork. A plate of doughnuts cools on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) He eats only doughnuts with smashed-up goose livers injected into them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tall, skinny man in a long trench-coat. He holds a Luger pistol. He stands in front of his farm, which is an apple orchard that stretches over thousands of acres. He has a mean face. He is Bean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Franklin Bean is a turkey and apple farmer. He keeps his birds in an orchard (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) (cont'd) where they run around squawking and gobbling, surrounded by apples. Bean aims his Luger and shoots a humming bird. Crazy turkeys run about among the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bean works at a moonshine-type cider still, boiling chemicals and sipping from a bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) He's probably anorexic, because he never eats anything. He's on a liquid diet of strong, alcoholic cider, which he makes from his apples. He's as skinny as a pencil, as smart as a whip -- and easily the biggest cusshole I've ever met in my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and Badger in Badger's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In summation, I think you just got to not do it, man. That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand what you're saying, and your comments are valuable, but I'm going to ignore your advice. Badger leaps out of his chair and slams the office door. He points his finger at Fox and screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cuss you are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cuss am I? Fox jumps up and points back at Badger, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't cussing point at me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you cussing with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look like I'm cussing with you? Fox and Badger begin to snarl and snap savagely, knocking into the furniture as they circle around the room pointing in each other's faces. Suddenly, they calm down all at once, sighing deeply. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One last thing: something's probably about to happen to me at work which I can't put my finger on but have a funny feeling about. How can I protect myself legally?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you about to get fired?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slash quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door with a frosted glass window. Letters painted on it read Gazette, Editor-in-Chief, Phillip Squirrel. Fox's silhouette stands across from that of a small squirrel sitting at a desk. The squirrel's silhouette says in a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slash I quit. Here's my letter of resignation. Fox's silhouette throws an envelope onto the squirrel's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two muskrats in orange moving company uniforms unloads boxes and furniture from a wagon and carries them into the tree. Fox holds open the front door and barks orders at them. Two muskrats in white painter's uniforms paints the walls of the living room and the trim around the windows with rollers and brushes. Fox stands on the drop-cloth and barks orders at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Two muskrats in blue electrician's uniforms work in the kitchen. Mrs. Fox watches over their shoulders and barks orders at them. Fox holds up a pair of flowered curtains in front of a window. He looks to Mrs. Fox. She stares at the curtains thoughtfully. She raises an eyebrow. Fox and Mrs. Fox sit in the windowsill looking out at the sunset. Ash stands in-between them. The flowered curtains wave in the breeze. Fox puffs on a pipe. Ash blows a soap bubble. Mrs. Fox puts out her paw and a butterfly lands on it. She smiles at Fox. He puts his arm around her. He raises a pair of binoculars to his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A binocular shot of an industrial shack with Boggis Chicken House #1 stencilled on the front of it. Fox lowers the binoculars. His eyes sparkle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Ash stands poised on a high branch over an inflatable swimming pool printed with a red-tartan plaid pattern. He wears over-sized swim trunks with a pattern of acorns printed on them. Fox sits in the grass eating an apple below with Mrs. Fox. She is painting at an easel. Ash yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch this, Dad! Fox looks up. Ash leaps into the air and does a spectacularly awkward back-flip during which he appears to have four arms and three legs randomly attached to his body, flailing wildly. He hits the water by the side of his head and smacks into the surface back-first with a pained yelp. Fox grimaces. He claps mildly. (NOTE: an alternate version of Ash with four arms and three legs randomly attached to his body will be used for this stunt.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good jump, Ash! Remember to keep your tail tucked! Fox looks at Mrs. Fox's canvas. It is a picture of the pond and landscape in severe weather with black clouds and lightning bolts. It is signed Felicity Fox. Fox raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still painting thunderstorms, I see. Fox sees a small, Samsonite suitcase on the ground next to a pair of yellow sneakers. He frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose suitcase is that? A boy's voice shouts from the high tree branch:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, everyone! Good afternoon! Fox, Mrs. Fox, and Ash look up, surprised. A second Fox cub stands poised on the edge of the limb. He is taller, leaner, sleeker, and it is immediately apparent even by his posture infinitely more graceful than Ash. He is Kristofferson. He wears a professional Speedo with a patch on it that says Swim Team. Fox brightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson! Welcome to our little tree! I see you brought your swimming trunks! Kristofferson steps off the branch and performs a reserved but perfect jack-knife. He enters the water splashlessly. Fox leaps to his feet, applauding with his paws above his head, whistling and hollering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that! This kid's a natural! I'm speechless, Kristofferson! Kristofferson smiles modestly and shrugs. Ash stares at him stonily. Fox turns to Mrs. Fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plus, he knows karate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Fox sits in his armchair reading the Gazette. Ash sits on a braided rug on the floor beside him reading a comic book called The Adventures of White Cape. On the cover, there is a picture of a ferret leaping off a motorcycle. Mrs. Fox is in the kitchen in the background flattening a hunk of dough with a rolling pin. Kristofferson is in the next room practicing tae-kwon-do. He wears khaki shorts, yellow sneakers, and a blue, short-sleeved, button-down shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think I'm an athlete?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without looking up) What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, I think I'm an athlete, and sometimes I feel like you guys don't see me that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the sub-text here? Ash thinks for a minute. He looks at Kristofferson in the next room. Kristofferson is now sitting Indian-style on the floor meditating. His paws are turned upward with his thumbs touching his index fingers forming a ring. Ash says loudly to Mrs. Fox in the kitchen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long is Kristofferson supposed to stay with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Until your uncle gets better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, but roughly how long do we plan to give him on that? Double-pneumonia isn't even really that big of a deal, is it? In the background, Kristofferson stands up again and starts practicing violent karate kicks. Mrs. Fox leans into the doorway and whispers forcefully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX As a matter of fact, it is. He's lucky to be alive. Now -- ASH Right, but -- Kristofferson yells suddenly as he does a spinning double- kick with a chop:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ki-ya! Everyone looks startled. Kristofferson resumes his tae-kwon- do practice with an angry, wounded look on his face. Mrs. Fox
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Lower your voice, Ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie sit in a porch swing on one of the middle branches of Fox's tree. They drink cups of coffee. Crickets chirp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kids are crazy, aren't they? You got to try it, though. Raising a family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Sometimes I feel like maybe I MIGHT -- FOX What do you think of this tree, by the way? It's great, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. No, I was just saying how some-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have one last part of what I was about to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going broke. You want to help me steal some chickens?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox's study, the next morning. A map of the valley with notes and arrows written all over it is spread across a desk. The door is closed with a towel jammed under it. A cricket match plays loudly on the radio. Fox sits in his armchair. Kylie sits in a creaky rocking chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to do this professionally, and I was very successful at it. I had to get out of it for personal reasons, but I've decided to secretly quit my job slash got fired to pursue it again. I'm bringing you in as my secretary and personal assistant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is actually kind of a big deal, so don't just say, "OK!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (clearing is throat) I'm going totape this formyrecords,so don't make a lot of sounds --meaning stop rocking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe we ought to turn off the radio, then. That's noisier than -- FOX I don't want people to eavesdrop on us, Kylie. Let me just tell this. Kylie stops rocking. Fox presses record on a tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master Plan. Phase one. Side A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That night. Fox stands on a rock at the edge of the woods looking through his binoculars. He lowers them and gives a hand-signal. Kylie joins him, and they start out along the moonlit ridge. Fox wears a dark car-coat and a black cap. Kylie has on a navy ski-hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) We'll start with Boggis' Chicken House #1. His only security is a few old hunting beagles and a low stone wall. Now a word about beagles: never look a beagle directly in the eye. And if -- KYLIE (V.0.) (INTERRUPTING) Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox and Kylie in Fox's study earlier that afternoon. Kylie
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beagles aren't so tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Well, first of all, one of these beagles has chronic rabies, which he's on medication for, and if you get bit by him you have to get shots in your stomach for six months. And, second -- listen, I'm not going to justify this to you. Just pay attention and stop interrupting me. I'm taping this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie shimmy down a steep embankment and cross a stream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) I picked some blueberries, butterflied them with a scalpel, and laced each one with ten milligrams of high-potency sleeping powder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox's paws meticulously sprinkle a powdered mickey into a dissected blueberry and stitch it shut with red thread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Enough to tranquilize a charging gorilla.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and Kylie in Fox's study earlier that afternoon. They now smoke pipes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we make them eat it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling, with utter certainty) Beagles love blueberries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie push through a bramble and climb to the top of an elderberry bush. Fox looks through his binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) If we approach with the wind in our faces, we'll smell the chicken livers on Boggis' breath from at least fifty yards away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Seventy-five chickens stand around quietly but anxiously, darting wildly nervous looks at one another. They eat bits of grain off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Remember: they aren't very smart, but they're incredibly paranoid -- so always kill a chicken in one bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and Kylie in Fox's study earlier that afternoon. They now drink whiskey sours. Fox repeats:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One bite, get it? Fox waits for Kylie to respond. Kylie does not. Fox frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you listening to me? I look into your eyes and I can't tell whether you're getting anything I'm saying. Kylie stares at Fox vacantly. He shrugs. (NOTE: an alternate set of eyeballs will be used for any shots indicating Kylie's vacant look.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie move swiftly through the tall grass. Fox pauses to sniff the air. He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few beagles, as we discussed, but we're ready for that. Fox and Kylie cross a dirt lane and come out of a shallow ditch. Fox licks the pinky of his paw and holds it up in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You feel that? The wind's in our faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kylie touches his face with his paw. He nods. Fox and Kylie run along the edge of the ditch. Kylie says casually:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, back in the old days, didn't they used to do a thing where if somebody saw a wolf, and -- FOX (STARTLED) What wolf? Fox stops in his tracks. His eyes dart about. Kylie looks at him curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, nothing? Never mind. Fox and Kylie veer off into shorter grasses. Fox points ahead, regaining his composure:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes the low stone wall. Not a problem. Fox and Kylie climb over a low stone wall and find themselves at the base of a chain-link fence eleven feet high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a chain-link fence, I guess. Did I not remember this? Maybe it's new. Let's pause. (SUDDENLY ANGRY) What the cuss? Where'd this giant fence come from? We had a master plan! Kylie motions to a yellow, plywood lightning bolt posted to the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this lightning bolt stand for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a second! I said, "Let's pause"! Pause. Fox pulls himself together. He turns to look at the plywood lightning bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That, I guess, hypothetically, could mean maybe this fence might be electric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I just hope it doesn't mean thunder. I have a phobia of that. Fox and Kylie climb a tree and crouch at the end of one of its branches. Fox produces a zip-loc bag filled with blueberries with white thread stitched into them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch this. Fox puts a blueberry into the end of a straw and shoots it out into the barnyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blueberry landing on the ground in front of Chicken House #1. A beagle approaches it and sniffs at it. He eats it. He looks very pleased. He falls over, out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox with an ecstatic expression on his face. He rapidly shoots more and more blueberries across the barnyard. Beagles eat blueberries and fall over, one after another. Fox and Kylie drop down into the barnyard and head for Chicken House #1. Fox whispers excitedly as they run:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beagles love blueberries! Didn't I tell you? The master plan's working again! Kylie raises his fist enthusiastically and trips over an unconscious beagle. He picks himself up quickly, and they weave among the rest of the beagles. They reach the entrance to the chicken house, open the door, and duck inside. Pause. There is an eruption of crazed squawking, screaming, and fighting from inside. The chicken house rumbles. Lights jolt on across the compound. An alarm goes off. Voices yell. The chicken house door swings open again, and Fox and Kylie emerge among a cloud of feathers. Fox carries two dead chickens, and Kylie has one live one. Fox yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said one bite, cuss it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying! I have a different kind of teeth from you! I'm an opossum!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kylie tries to bite the chicken on the neck. The chicken is unharmed. Kylie shrugs. Fox kills the chicken with one quick flick of the jaws. Kylie looks horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's so grisly! There's blood and everything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're killing chickens! There's going to be blood in this story! Follow me! Fox and Kylie dash to the electric fence. They stop in front of it. Kylie looks to Fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the master escape plan? Fox hesitates, confused. A gunshot fires from among the chicken houses. Fox shouts to Kylie:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me again! Fox and Kylie run back across the barnyard, past the beagles as they begin to wake up and stagger around. Farmhands appear, loading shotguns and running into the confusion. Fox and Kylie race by, unnoticed, among them. They dart into the house through a flap in the back door. The lights are out in the kitchen. They take a moment, breathing hard in the darkness. Kylie shakes his head in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. That was amazing. How did we do that? We ran the other way or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea. Fox opens the door-flap a crack. He looks out and sees Boggis opening the front gate to let out his beagles and farmhands, barking and shooting, as they search for the intruders. Fox shouts to Kylie:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy cuss! They opened the gate! Follow me again! Lightning quick, Fox and Kylie burst out through the door- flap, race across the barnyard, and dart through the open gate. Up the road, Boggis screams furiously as he runs with his pack of beagles and farmhands. Fox and Kylie fly into the bushes. As they race through the underbrush Fox says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hit the five and dime on the way home! We need to make some fake price tags and wrap these chickens in wax-paper so it looks like we got them at the butcher shop! Fox and Kylie howl ecstatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fox's paw lifts a silver dome off a perfectly roasted chicken with an apple in its mouth. Fox and Mrs. Fox sit at a candle-lit table eating chicken and drinking wine. Ash, Kristofferson, and Kylie sit at a slightly miniature table eating chicken and drinking milk. Fox laughs hysterically as he tells his wife a story. Wine comes out of his nose. Fox and Kylie dash out the door of Boggis' Chicken House #7 carrying three more dead chickens. Lights jolt on. Farmhands run out firing shotguns. Fox and Kylie escape through a hole cut into the electric fence. Fox and Kylie dash out the window of Bunce's Poultry Barn C carrying two dead ducks and a goose. Alarms ring. Farmhands run out firing pistols. Fox and Kylie escape through a hole knocked into a brick wall. Fox and Kylie dash out the gates of Bean's Apple Orchard XII carrying two dead turkeys and a basket of apples. Automatic doors close. Farmhands run out firing rifles. Fox and Kylie escape through a hole chopped into a burning barricade. Fox and Kylie run full-speed through a clover field in the dark. The camera zooms in slowly on their faces as they ford a stream, leap a fallen hawthorn, and cross into the willow glade. They look exhilarated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Mrs. Fox studies a crayon price-tag labelled $4 attached to a wax-paper-wrapped parcel. She opens the parcel and holds up a dead chicken by the leg. There is a small metal clip around its ankle. She examines it. She frowns. Fox comes in, grabs an apple out of a bowl, and starts back out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Where'd you get this chicken?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I picked it up at the Five-and-Dime last night on my way back from -- MRS. FOX It's got a Boggis Farms tag around its ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. Must've escaped from there before I bought it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Ash, Kristofferson, and Kylie sit at the children's table eating dinner. Next to Ash, there is a small, slightly beaten- up statue of a fox with his front legs raised in the air holding a medal above his head. Kylie points at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This? Nothing. Just some old trophy I won for being an athlete. Fox and Mrs. Fox sit at the adults' table. Fox guzzles down a last sip of wine and says with his mouth full of food:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm supposed to cover this book party at some animal's nest in a tobacco field down the hill, so me and Kylie are going to hop over there and give it a whirl. Don't wait up. Fox pulls his napkin out of his collar, drops it on the table, and stands up. Mrs. Fox asks cooly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX What's the book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some memoir. I'll get him to sign you a copy. Fox kisses Mrs. Fox on the cheek. She looks at him suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinner was -- (doing a little gesture)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pitch-perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie walk among the trees. They are dressed in their prowling outfits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spotted a couple of broken burglar bars underneath the back door to Bean's secret cider cellar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're breaking into Bean's house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cellar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where he lives?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where he keeps the cider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below where he lives. Ash, dressed in his own prowling outfit, is walking with Fox and Kylie. Fox stops short:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you come from? Go back to the tree and do your homework!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to help you steal some cider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to a book party! And keep your mouth shut about any cider, because no one ever said that! Get out of here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Dad -- FOX But nothing! You're going to get me in a lot of trouble! The three animals stand in silence for a minute. Fox points to his tree. Ash turns and starts back home. Fox shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the cuss does that kid get off? Can you believe that? How'd he get tipped off? You think he's going to tell on us? Fox turns to Kylie. Kylie looks back at him vacantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we go any further, from now on can you give me some kind of signal once in a while just so I know any of this is getting through to you? Pause. Kylie makes a slight motion with his paw. Fox hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that it? OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie dart across the yard and around the back of Bean's farmhouse. Kylie whispers as they run:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One time this wolf -- FOX (IRRITATED) What's with all the wolf talk? Can we give it a rest, for once? Fox climbs onto a garbage pail and pulls open a window shutter. He and Kylie shimmy in-between two bent burglar bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A vast, damp, gloomy cellar with hundreds of glass jars stacked from floor to ceiling. Each jar is marked Cider. Fox and Kylie come inside and quietly drop to the brick floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at all this apple juice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apple juice? Apple juice? We didn't come here for apple juice. This is some of the strongest, finest alcoholic cider money can buy -- or that can even be stolen. It burns in your throat, boils in your stomach, and tastes almost exactly like pure, melted gold. (SUDDENLY) Let's crack open one these 'shine jars and do a shooter. A match strikes in the darkness. Fox and Kylie look around the room frantically. On the highest shelf, peering out from behind a huge jar, they see an enormous rat in a striped shirt with a lit match in his claw. He puts the flame in his mouth to snuff it out and holds the matchstick in his teeth. He is longer than a fox and wiry, but with a small pot-belly. He wears a black beret and moves like a beatnik. He takes a draw from a small rubber tube inserted in the neck of his cider jar. He says with a slightly sinister New
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all are trespassin', now. Illegally. 'Round these parts, we don't take kindly to cider poachers. Fox and Rat stare at each other. Fox says, finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've aged badly, Rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gettin' a little long in the tooth, yourself, partner. Rat spins around and hurls himself scuttling over a shelf, down the wall, and through the air onto the brick floor at Fox's feet. He flicks open a switchblade and brandishes it. He hisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kylie shrieks and darts into a hole where a brick is missing in the wall. Fox takes an old-fashioned boxing stance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's your old lady doin'? Kylie peers out from his hole in the wall nervously. Fox and Rat circle each other slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you refer to my wife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was the town tart, in her day. Wild and foot-loose and pretty as a mink stole. She was a creme brulee -- until you made an honest woman out of her, Mr. Fox. Kylie says, intrigued, from his hole:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, not. I mean, certainly, she lived. We all did. It was a different time. Let's not use a double-standard. She marched against the -- KYLIE But town tart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. Rat lunges at Fox with his switchblade. Fox dodges nimbly. He cocks an eyebrow and smiles:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was close, Rat. Be careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm as careful as a -- A door at the top of the stairs opens suddenly with a loud creak. Rat and Fox look terrified. They both dart away and hide behind cider jars. A heavy-set, middle-aged housekeeper carrying a rolling pin comes down the stairs and walks straight over to the shelf where Fox is hiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many jars should I bring up, ma'am? A strong, almost masculine woman's voice answers from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Two, I guess. The housekeeper grabs the two jars directly next to the one Fox is hiding behind and tucks them under her arm. Fox tenses his body. He shivers slightly. A graze of the red fur of his arm sticks out barely from behind his jar. The housekeeper hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drank three yesterday, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, take three. The housekeeper grabs Fox's jar. Fox closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't. The housekeeper stops with her hand on the neck of Fox's jar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three's too many. It's unhealthy. He's anorexic. Bring two. The housekeeper lets go of Fox's jar. Fox relaxes slightly. The housekeeper grabs Fox's jar again. Fox tenses up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But maybe, just in case -- MASCULINE VOICE Two's plenty. The housekeeper lets go of Fox's jar and walks away. She goes back up the stairs and closes the door. Kylie says in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my cuss. That was like a scene out of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens again. An exceptionally tall, powerfully built woman in a black dress and Wellingtons, with grey hair pulled- back in a bun, bright green eyes, and a meat cleaver tucked under her apron strings comes swiftly down the stairs. She
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . eyeballs the corners of the room. She is Mrs. Bean. She says thickly (in her masculine voice):
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEAN To whom it may concern: if I catch a rat in a black beret drinking Mr. Bean's secret cider without his express permission, I intend to chop said rat's head off, brine it, pickle it, and bake it in a vermin casserole. I hope this clarifies my position on the matter. Sincerely, Evelyn Bean. Mrs. Bean turns and goes back up the stairs. She closes the door. Pause. Rat's voice says from the shadows:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Mrs. Bean, your language, while somewhat purple, is nevertheless impossible to misinterpret. However -- comma -- given the proximity of said rat at the moment of your -- The door at the top the stairs opens again. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and Kylie running away from Bean's farmhouse with two jars of cider. They both look badly shaken. A gunshot rings out taking us to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Bean is standing darkly in his front doorway. Smoke drifts from the end of his Luger, pointed at the ceiling. A broken light bulb hangs from a wire above his head. Boggis and Bunce sit together on the porch in rocking chairs, startled, staring at Bean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to give a speech, and at the end of it -- I'm going to throw a twist into this plot. Bean lights a cigarette and begins to walk slowly around the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First truth: this is the most ambitious fox we've ever encountered, bar none. Bean spins around and shoots out a second light bulb. Boggis and Bunce look uneasy. Bean continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second truth: the meaning of ambition is defined in the dictionary. Bean jumps and rolls and shoots out a third light bulb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third truth: the weakness of the ambitious man is his Achilles heel -- Bean quickly shoots out three more light bulbs behind his back, over his shoulder, and between his legs. The porch goes dark. He flicks on a flashlight and points it in his two colleague's faces. They look scared. Bean says urgently:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but I've already figured out where this fox lives, and tomorrow night we're going to camp in the bushes, wait for him to come out of the hole in his tree, and shoot the cuss to smithereens. How's that grab you, fellas? Boggis and Bunce hesitate. They nod and murmur their approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and Kylie come quietly into the half-lit kitchen dressed in their prowling outfits. They walk to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Another book party? Fox and Kylie turn around, startled. Mrs. Fox sits on a stool in the darkened pantry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah! I didn't see you. Sitting in the dark over there. Yeah, no. Actually, there's a fire. I just got the call. They said maybe it's arson? I got to interview the marshall and see what's -- MRS. FOX Kylie, is he telling the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to be put in the middle of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Kylie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX If what I think is happening is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- it better not be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boggis, Bunce, and Bean waiting crouched in the bushes. Bean licks his finger and holds it up to test the direction of the wind. He nods, points to his nose, and gives a thumbs-up to Boggis and Bunce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox pokes his head up out of his hole. He sniffs once. He moves an inch forward and stops. He sniffs again. He waits a moment and listens. He steps out of the hole and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice job covering for me. Next time
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A twig snaps. Fox freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boggis, Bunce, and Bean frozen in the bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The branches of the trees as the wind suddenly changes its direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox on high alert. He rapidly sniffs the air three times in a row. He turns to a confused Kylie and says, panicking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All three! Fox and Kylie spin around and dart back into the hole as Boggis, Bunce, and Bean open fire wildly from the bushes. A barrage of bullets and buckshot rips into the tree-bark. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Smoke from the three guns floats upward in the night air. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean approach the tree. Bean shines his flashlight on Fox's hole. In the circle of light on the ground lies the tattered, blood- stained remains of Fox's tail. Bean picks it up and holds it in the air in front of Boggis and Bunce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got the tail, but we missed the fox. Pause. Bean takes out his walkie-talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Petey? You and the boys sober up and get out here on the A.S.A.P. Bring eleven shovels, three pick-axes, 500 rounds of ammunition, and a bottle of apple cider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Mrs. Fox licks the stump of Fox's tail and mends it with gauze and medical tape. She looks furious. Kylie and the Fox cubs watch, concerned. Ash says uncertainly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll grow back, won't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) Tails don't grow back, except for lizards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tails don't grow back. I'm going to be tail-less for the rest of my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, anyway, it's not half as bad as double-pneumonia, right? (pointing to Kristofferson) His dad's got one foot in the grave and one foot on a banana peel. That's a lot worse than -- Kristofferson hurls an acorn violently onto the floor. It ricochets off a wall and into a teacup. Everyone falls silent. Kristofferson turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, everyone. I'm going to go meditate for half an hour. Kristofferson walks out of the room. Mrs. Fox looks at Ash and says angrily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You've got twenty-nine minutes to come up with a proper apology. Ash crosses his arms in front of his chest and stares straight ahead into space grimly. Fox says suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with the crazy outfit? Why a cape and the pants tucked into your socks? Ash does not respond. Fox sighs. Mrs. Fox finishes bandaging his tail. Fox goes over to the wall and stands with his back to the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got fired slash quit the Gazette and started stealing chickens on the sly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (ICILY) That tail was the first thing I ever noticed about you. It was easily the most attractive tail for at least 50 miles in every direction. It was probably your single best quality -- and now it's gone forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox lying in bed staring at the ceiling in the dark next to Mrs. Fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the cuss didn't I listen my lawyer? At this point we'll be lucky if we can flip this tree for half of what we've already sunk into it. Fox flips over onto his stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be able to sleep on my back for six weeks -- and on my stomach I feel congested. Why the cuss didn't I listen to my lawyer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (BITTERLY) Because you don't listen to anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sitting up suddenly) What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (PAUSE) What? I said -- There is a quiet scraping sound from above. Fox jumps out of bed. He hollers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up! Everybody! They're digging us out! There is a scrunch and then a loud thump from above. Mrs. Fox looks at Fox intensely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX They'll kill the children!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over my dead body, they will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (ANGRILY) That's what I'm saying! You'd be dead, too, in that scenario!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm arguing against that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (SCREAMING) What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you yelling at me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! Stop! Stop! Fox and Mrs. Fox turn quickly to Kylie standing in the doorway with a red blanket wrapped around his shoulders. Ash
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . and Kristofferson stand behind him. They look terrified. Kylie shouts in a pained voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say one thing, she says another, and it all changes back again! The point of a shovel pierces the ceiling. Everyone looks up and stares in shock. Fox suddenly leaps across the room with a wild energy, scrambles halfway up a wall, and throws over two chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got it! There's not a moment to lose! Why didn't I think of this before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Think of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think of the one thing a fox does quicker than a man, quicker than any other animal in the world! (at the top of his lungs)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone digging furiously. Dirt flies everywhere. The shot booms down into the ground, among the roots of the tree, through buried pebbles, layers of soil, and subterranean mineral deposits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shot stops at the bottom of a dark hole deep, deep underground. Mrs. Fox lies on the floor, breathing heavily, with a lit lantern at her side. The cubs are sprawled out around her. Kylie leans in the corner with his shirt off tied around his waist. Fox stands up and clears his throat. Everyone looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's time for me to give us a pep talk and explain some things. (commencing a speech) A very long time ago -- MRS. FOX May I have a word with you privately?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're in a hole. Where -- MRS. FOX Just on the other side of this mineral deposit. Follow me. Fox reluctantly follows Mrs. Fox through a crack in the bedrock and into a small air-pocket with glittering quartz walls. She wheels on Fox:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX I'm going to lose my temper now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, when -- Mrs. Fox scratches Fox across the face, slicing a quick sliver into his fur. Fox cringes away with his paws up protectively. He lowers his paws. His eyes fill with tears. (NOTE: the scar in Fox's fur never grows back.) Mrs. Fox takes a deep breath. She says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Twelve fox-years ago, you made a promise to me while we were caged inside that fox- trap that, if we survived, you would never steal another chicken, goose, turkey, duck, or squab, whatever they are. I believed you. Why did you lie to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm a wild animal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You're also a husband and a father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to tell you the truth about myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX I don't care about the truth about yourself. Fox looks down at the ground. He nods and tries to contain his emotions. Mrs. Fox watches him coldly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX This story is too predictable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Predictable? Really? What happens in the end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (QUIETLY) In the end, we all die -- unless you change. Mrs. Fox walks out of the air-pocket. Fox stands alone in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The next morning. There is a large hole in the side of the hill, under Fox's tree. The ceiling to the living room has been completely removed. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean stand half- underground with their heads sticking out of the hole, breathing hard, with dirty shovels over their shoulders. Bunce stands on Fox's tiny club chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These foxes dig like a bunch of hyperactive gophers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Franklin? You got another twist for this plot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say that again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say you got another -- Bean whips out his walkie-talkie and twirls it like a six- shooter. He presses a button on it and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Petey? Get me the current contact info for Earl Malloy on the A.S.A.P.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Earl Malloy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You mean over at Malloy Consolidated? Oh, he does rentals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he rent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three yellow and black, murderous, brutal bulldozer digging- tractors with Malloy Consolidated painted on the sides of them. They make a terrible, high-pitched growling noise and spit black grease and smoke. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean stand among the tractors nodding giddily to each other. They scramble into the drivers' seats and begin ripping into the hillside. Bunce sits on a dictionary to see over the dashboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox, Mrs. Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson digging frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tractors grabbing huge chunks of earth and tossing them into the meadow. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean, drunk with digging, laugh manically as the controls of their tractors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's kick some fox cuss!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm cussing loving this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's hyper-cussing-active now? Bean throws his tractor into top gear. The teeth of the giant shovels clank against each other, ripping through the tree's roots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A temperature gauge with its needle pushing the limits of the red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grizzled, white-haired man in a greasy yellow and black jumpsuit and coke-bottle protective eyeglasses. A patch on his pocket says E. Malloy. He watches the farmers digging crazily with the tractors. Sparks from the mayhem reflect dancing on his lenses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These machines weren't made to be handled like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hill with half its earth dug out from under the tree. The tree still stands precariously above the wild tractors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hill now razed with the fallen, old beech tree laying on its side as the tractors dig deeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tractors almost completely below ground in a deep crater. A crowd of neighbors and local press from the town has gathered and watches as the tractors stop digging and rumble up out of the crater. The motors go quiet. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean climb down from their tractors. They look angry and tired. They stand among the workers and onlookers. A television reporter with an Action 13 camera crew confronts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farmer, correct me if I'm misreading the data, you've successfully destroyed the scenery, but the alleged fox remains at large. What will you three prominent farmers do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Dan, I can tell you what we're not going to do. We're not going to let him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you concerned about the possibility
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no further dialogue in this scene. Bean turns away from the reporter and pulls Boggis and Bunce aside. He addresses them with calm intensity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going home until we smoke this son-of-a-cuss out his hole, string him up on a clothesline, and fly him like a kite. Boggis, how many men have you got working on your farm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bunce?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I've got thirty-seven. That's 108 men altogether. Now what do I got here? Two quitters -- or are you staying with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That night. A helicopter with a Bean, inc. decal on the side of it circles the crater scanning the dark terrain with a searchlight. There are tents, trucks, and 108 men gathered around the perimeter. They sit on bricks and logs and are armed with bats, pistols, rifles, shotguns, bows and arrows, and hatchets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox, his family, and Kylie lie exhausted on the floor of their deep hole. The walls are covered with knotted roots and vines. Fox says to Kylie:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of those slovenly farmers is probably wearing my tail as a necktie by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're paranoid, Foxy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Bean sitting in her kitchen watching television next to an extremely skinny, freckled twelve year-old boy. The boy points at the screen and laughs to himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at Dad's tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The television set. Bean is on-screen with the Action 13 reporter. He wears a fox-fur necktie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT There is a full moon. Lanterns glow in the farmers' tents. A group of farmhands sit around a campfire next to the crater. One of them cooks a chicken on a spit. Another sits on a log playing a banjo. He is Petey. He sings:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout a handsome little fox Let me sing you folks a yarn. Hey, diddle-dee, doddle-do, doodle-dum! 'Twas a splendid little feller Full of wit 'n' grace 'n' charm. Say, zippy-zee, yappy-yo, google-gum! The shot moves past the leathery faces of the other farmhands as they listen: amused, moved, hungry, tired, charmed, annoyed, whistling, playing a jew's harp, trying to sing along but not really knowing the words, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like any little critter needin' Vittels for his littl'uns, Well, he stole, and he cheated, And he lied to survive. Doodle-dum, diddle-die, doddle-diddle- doodle-dee! Zippy-zo, zippy-zay, zippy-zappy- zoopy-zee! (this verse is spoken:) Let me take a little tick now To color in the scene: 'Cross the valley lived three yokels Name of Boggis, Bunce, and Bean. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (back to singing:) Now these three crazy jackies had our hero on the run. Shot the tail off the cuss With a fox-shootin' gun. But that stylish little fox Was as clever as a whip. Dug as quick as a gopher Who was a hyper-ack-a-tive. Now those three farmers sit 'Twhere there's a hole 'twas once a hill. Hey, diddle-dee, doddle-do, doodle-dum! And as far as I can reckon They're a-settin' up there still. (SLOWLY) Way, zippy-zee, yappy-yo, google -- BEAN (INTERRUPTING) What are you singing, Petey? Petey stops short. Everyone turns quickly and sees Bean standing over them in the darkness with his Luger in one hand and a cigarette in the other. Petey looks nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I was just kind of making it up as I was going along... Petey trails off. Bean shakes his head. He looks highly irritated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just weak song-writing! You wrote a bad song, Petey! Bean throws his cigarette into the campfire. He storms away. Petey turns to the other farmhands. Everyone looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (18 Fox-Days)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning in the farmers' camp. The cook flips an egg on a skillet. He puts it on a plate with bacon and hands it to Petey. Petey asks him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long can a fox go without food or water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The exhausted foxes and Kylie underground. Kylie says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can only answer as an opossum, but I don't think I can last more than another couple of hours before I get completely dehydrated and starve to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? Ash points. Everyone looks. A tiny hole appears in the wall at the end of the tunnel. Dirt crumbles out of it -- and a bit of metal catches a glint. Fox and his family watch, frozen. A breath of air blows into the tunnel. The flame on Mrs. Fox's lantern flickers once and goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a sound! Silence. There is a sudden, loud scrabbling noise. A match strikes. Fox touches it to Mrs. Fox's lantern-wick. The tiny hole in the wall has become a large one. Badger stands in front of Fox with his law partner Beaver, Beaver's overgrown, hulking son, a medium-sized mole, and a grey field mouse with a bandana tied in a "do-rag" style around his head. Badger has a spoon in his hand. Fox and Badger erupt at each other, screaming simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You scared the cuss out of us!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you not to buy at nine and a cussing half!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't just bang into somebody's cussing tunnel!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you cussing yelling at me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're cussing right I'm cussing yelling!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all cussing starving to death because of you, you mangy, cussing, little cuss! Fox and Badger snarl and scratch at each other, circling around the hole. They calm down slightly. Badger continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been digging in circles for three days. Half the woods've been obliterated. Nobody can get out. Right now my wife's huddled at the bottom of the flint-mine with Mrs. Mole, Mrs. Beaver, Rabbit's ex- girlfriend, no food, no water, and twenty- seven hungry, whining, starving, little animal brats. This is a total cluster- cuss for everybody! Fox looks around the room at the entire gaunt, dirty, emaciated assembly. Everyone stares at him angrily. He swallows. The mole says softly.:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to see a little -- (SUDDENLY CRYING) -- sunshine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're nocturnal, Phil. Your eyes barely even open, on a good day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick of your double-talk. We have rights! Beaver's son looms over Ash and Kristofferson in a muddy alcove on the side of the tunnel. He pokes Ash in the chest with the finger of his paw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't like you, and we hate your dad. You're too snazzy. You dress like a girl. You're creative. Now grab some of that mud, chew it in your mouth, and swallow it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (scared and disgusted) I'm not going to eat mud!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuss, yeah, you are. Beaver's son grabs a handful of mud, smashes it into Ash's mouth, and forces his jaws up and down in a chewing motion. Ash coughs and splutters. Kristofferson frowns. He takes off his shoes with his feet. He says with a quiet ferocity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do that. Beaver's son looks to Kristofferson. He looks down at Kristofferson's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you take your shoes off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I don't break your nose when I kick it. Kristofferson kicks Beaver's son in the face, karate chops his neck, elbow-jabs him twice in the gut, and flips the enormous youth over his shoulder and into the mud. Beaver's son gets up, crying, and walks out of the alcove. Ash watches blankly with mud all over his mouth as Kristofferson puts his shoes back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can fight my own fights. Badger and Fox stand facing each other at the end of the tunnel. Badger says aggressively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those farmers aren't going to quit until they've got you and every member of your family nailed upside-down to a bloody stick with your eyes gorged out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is getting a little too personal. Badger waits for Fox to continue. Fox stares into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a minute. Fox turns and walks away. He faces the wall of the tunnel. He sits down on a rock. Everyone watches him uncertainly. They look at each other. Badger starts to say something, but Kylie cuts him off sharply:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh! Badger falls silent. Fox sits with his chin on his paw, lost in concentrated thought. He stands up. He nods repeatedly and begins to pace. His eyes dart from one spot to another. His paws move abruptly around in the air drawing lines and shapes. He freezes and looks straight up at the ceiling of the tunnel. He snaps the fingers of his paw and looks to the others. He says with a cautious excitement:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got an idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could be a good one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lay it on us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might save our lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say the idea! Fox looks down at Ash, who stands beside him with mud still on his mouth. He nods. He says suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! Let's try it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox runs over to Mrs. Fox:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to the flint-mine. Tell Mrs. Badger, Rabbit's ex-girlfriend, et al. that help is on the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (SKEPTICALLY) Is help on the way? Fox grips Mrs. Fox's paw. He looks into her eyes and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure as cuss hope so. Mrs. Fox detects a special, familiar, inspired light in her husband's eyes at this moment. She nods. She hands Ash the lantern. She straightens the neck-line of his cape, licks the mud off Ash's snout, and scrambles away down Badger's tunnel. Ash wants to cry but does not. Fox turns to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, this time we must dig in a very special direction. Fox feels the walls with his paws. Everyone watches attentively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to kind of feel out the vibe. Fox stops. He points slightly downwards and due south. He says with quiet anticipation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Begin. Everyone starts digging, slowly but intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The diggers one hundred yards later. Fox suddenly whistles and raises his fist. The diggers stop digging. Fox feels the ceiling with his paws. He knocks something hard. It sounds hollow. He looks at the others with a funny expression and raises an eyebrow. Fox carefully pushes up a floorboard. It creaks loudly. They all duck down and wait. Nothing happens. Fox pushes up a second floorboard. He cautiously pokes his head up through
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . the gap. He lets out a shriek of excitement and whispers excitedly down to the others:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've done it! I've done it, first time! Come up and see where you are, my darlings! Everyone scrambles up out of the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Everyone stands in the middle of Boggis' Chicken House #1. The room is teeming with chickens, which stare at them nervously. There are black chickens, white chickens, brown chickens, and one that combines all three colors. Fox
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hit it slap in the middle! Do you get how incredible this is? The others nod. They look dazed and wild. Fox holds up his hands and whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lose your heads, now. Let's do this properly. First, everyone have a drink of water. Fox leads the others over to the chickens' drinking trough. They all lap up the cool water. Fox dries his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox seizes a black chicken violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ash and Kristofferson running down the tunnel carrying two dead, black chickens. They turn three corners and arrive at the mossy hollow. They look inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and the other diggers tunnel under the silo in front of Bunce Industries. Cows eat grass in the pasture above. Fox and the other diggers comes out of a hole in the floor and dance an ecstatic jig in a great storeroom lined to the ceiling with plucked ducks and geese. Smoked hams and sides of bacon dangle from the rafters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox and the other diggers tunnel under the windmill in front of Bean, inc. Sheep eat clover in the field above. Fox and the other diggers comes out of a hole in the floor and dance an ecstatic jig in a corrugated plastic and metal pen among dozens of gobbling turkeys. Fox and the other diggers race dancing ecstatically back through the complex network of tunnels carrying dead turkeys, geese, bacon, flour, salt, sugar, jars of cider, and a portable television set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The flint-mine is a large but cozy space with stone walls, a dirt floor, a small kitchen, and a fireplace. There are rows of cots, sleeping bags, boxes, blankets, and suitcases for all the refugee animals. All the animals have gathered together and drink cider cocktails while small rabbits, skunks, and field mice set the table. The room is festooned with garlands. A well-dressed mole smoking a pipe plays the piano. A bespectacled rabbit leans against it humming a tune. Weasel stands in the corner talking with Beaver.
direction.name: direction
