direction.raw_text: What am I going to do? I'm going to hold him to the terms of the contract. It's not my fault they uprooted it. Kristofferson serves cranberry punch from a tureen in the corner. Ash goes over to him and holds out a mug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say I owe you an apology for some of the mean things I said about your father's illness. His double-pneumonia or whatever they're calling it now. Kristofferson ladles Ash a cupful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there it is. I hope we can continue our relationship as cousins or family members or however you want to define
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly more intense)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but do me a favor for yourself. The next time you have a problem with something I've said, come to me as a fox (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and let's deal with it right then and not let it blow up into a whole, huge thing involving parents and so on. Agreed? Ash drinks his punch in one long sip and holds out the empty mug for a refill. Kristofferson nods slowly. He points at Ash with his ladle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to teach you karate. Badger sits next to the fireplace with Fox and Kylie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can imagine how painful, even just emotionally, that must be for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, it's not the end of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, but, Foxy, how humiliating! Having your whole tail blown clean off by a -- FOX (COOLY) Can we drop it? Kristofferson starts to refill Ash's mug again. Ash suddenly puts his paw over the brim. Kristofferson hesitates. Ash raises an eyebrow and says mysterriously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever tasted one of Mrs. Bean's famous nutmeg-ginger-apple snaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A large fire truck drives up to the destroyed hill with firemen hanging off the back and sides. It parks among the tractors and tents. The chief, in a white helmet, goes over to Boggis, Bunce, and Bean waiting at the mouth of the pit. A patch on his sleeve says O.W.F.R.P.F. Farmhands and firemen circle around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's got me a donation for the old Wounded Fireman's Retirement Pension Fund? Bean pulls a yellow check out of his inside pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here. (pointing behind him) Let me show you this hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Candles glow all around. Everyone is seated at the long dining room table, and a magnificent feast with every variety of fruit, meat, vegetable, and roasted bird has been laid out in front of them. They tear into their meals, eating and drinking ferociously. Crumbs, juices, blood, and bones fly into the air. Jaws snap and chew. There is no conversation. Badger suddenly stands and rings a knife against his cider glass. Everyone looks up, taking a breather from the frenzy of eating. Badger clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it took a near-catastrophe for all of you to finally take me up on my offer to have you over to the flint-mine for dinner, but I guess we have -- FOX (INTERRUPTING) I'm sorry. Maybe my invitation got lost in the mail. Does anybody know what this badger's talking about? Everyone laughs. Fox sits at the opposite end of the table with a crooked smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Clive's right -- (STANDING UP) -- in all seriousness -- (aside, to Badger)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: excuse me, B. Fox raises his cider glass. Badger reluctantly sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we do have those three ugly, cusshole farmers to thank for one thing: reminding us to be thankful and aware of each other. I'm going to say it again. (GESTURING EXPANSIVELY) Aware. Badger whispers to his wife:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foxy cuss-blocked my toast, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hole where Fox's tree once stood. The dead tree lies on its side. A fireman slides a thick hose deep into the tunnel. He looks behind him and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready. The shot moves backwards along the hose, past seven more firemen signalling to each other with: a thumbs-up, a snap, a fist in the air, a swirl of the fingers, a peace symbol, an A- OK, and a hook-'em Horns. The shot continues past Boggis, Bunce, and Bean helping to hold the hose in position. Boggis growls. Bunce hisses. Bean snarls. The shot arrives at a pump on the side of the fire truck. The chief points:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her rip. A fireman cranks a huge wrench on a steel nut. A pressure gauge shoots to maximum. The fire truck and hose begin to vibrate loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ash and Kristofferson crouched under a drain-cover pushed just-open next to a refrigerator. They peer out across a bright, clean, white kitchen at a plate of perfect, golden cookies on a counter-top next to an open window with a step- ladder directly in front of it. They look at each other. They look around the quiet, empty room. Ash shrugs. Ash and Kristofferson dart out, leaving the drain-cover propped-up. They race over the linoleum. They climb the step- ladder and stop at the plate. Ash swoons and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're still warm. Ash and Kristofferson gather more cookies than they can possibly carry, eating as they collect them. Crumbs go everywhere. On the other side of the room, the drain-cover falls shut with a loud clank. Ash and Kristofferson look up, wildly startled. All at once they hear in a simultaneous cacophony: the back door bursting open, a boy and two beagles shouting and barking, the pantry door slamming, Mrs. Bean and her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . middle-aged housekeeper clanging pots and pans and arguing, a timer on the counter-top ringing, and a raven fluttering to the windowsill and cawing. Ash and Kristofferson panic silently. They drop the cookies and fly down the step-ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox in mid-toast:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've stepped on some toes and alienated a few of you over the past few days -- but is it wrong for me to suggest we might've done worse than having an incredible banquet in a beautiful flint-mine surrounded by our favorite animals? Look at each other. Here we are. Wow. Now I've already had too much to drink, and I'm feeling sentimental, but I'm going to say something, anyway, which nobody wants to admit, but I think is probably true: we beat 'em. We beat those farmers, and now we're triumphantly eating their roasted chicken, their sizzling duck, their succulent turkey, their foie gras de -- (SUDDENLY) Where'd the boys go? Ash? Kristofferson? (to Mrs. Fox) What am I hearing again, baby? What's happening? Am I still paranoid? There is a low, distant rumbling which rapidly builds to a deafening roar. Everyone waits, frozen. A single drop of water drips from the ceiling into Badger's water glass. Fox turns to Badger and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's pause again. A wild deluge smashes into the room flooding the flint-mine and tunnels with a blasting current that sweeps everyone and everything away chaotically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire party of well-dressed animals and their plates, furniture, chickens, etc. shooting down the tunnel with the rushing waters. Fox, helpless, holding his breath, looks to the others underwater: Badger shakes his head in disgust; Rabbit makes a fierce grimace; Mole bares his teeth ferociously; Beaver rants angrily with bubbles coming out off his mouth; and Kylie stares ahead vacantly, holding his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox turns sadly to Mrs. Fox. She looks terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The flood blasts out of a wide pipe rocketing the animals into a murky, brick cavern with drainpipes on all sides and three inches of black water on its floor. Fox picks himself up, dazed and scared, and looks around at his soaked friends and their families.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the cuss just happened? Something with water. That was dangerous. Is anyone hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all hurt! My entire flint-mine just got demolished!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's do a head-count! Everybody pick a buddy! Each animal turns to his neighbor and establishes their buddy relationship. Fox looks wildly agitated as his eyes dart about, searching. He shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd the boys go? Ash? Kristofferson? Ash's voice cracks on the other side of the cavern:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here. Everyone turns to see Ash standing at the mouth of a smaller pipe. He looks devastated and terrified. Fox points to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ash! Who's your buddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson, but I lost him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lost him? Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went for cookies. Everyone turns to Fox. Fox yells desperately:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson! Fox sprints around the cavern, splashing, digging, and ducking in and out of tunnels as the others join his frantic search. His voice sounds pained as he shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson! Kristofferson! Kristofferson!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three farmers standing next to the fire truck. Bean holds a soaked, half-conscious Kristofferson up in the air by the tail. Kristofferson is quietly crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrap this wet, little mutt in a newspaper and put him in a box with some holes punched in the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Everyone has gathered together. They are all in a state of shock. Fox turns to Mrs. Fox beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your brother's going to kill me, if he survives his double-pneumonia. Beaver runs into the brick cavern out of a drainpipe,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only one way out of this sewer, but the manhole cover's closed, and there's a station-wagon parked on it -- which means we're permanently stuck down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still think we beat 'em, Foxy? Everyone turns to Fox and stares at him coldly. Fox sits down on the floor, in the water. He says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody take over. I'm not in charge anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everyone looks around at each other. They don't know what to do. Mrs. Fox sits down in the water next to Fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me to change, but I can't -- (REALIZING) -- except, possibly, on some level, I think I just did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (PAUSE) Well, then maybe we're not all going to die. Fox looks to Mrs. Fox. He stands up suddenly. He takes Mrs. Fox's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse us, everyone. Fox leads Mrs. Fox over to a ledge near a cement waterfall on the far side of the brick cavern. He puts his arm around her waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badger's right. These farmers aren't going to quit until they catch me. I shouldn't have lied to your face. I shouldn't have resigned slash gotten fired from the Gazette. I shouldn't have pushed these farmers so far and tried to embarrass them and cuss with their heads. I enjoyed it, but I shouldn't have done it -- and now there's only one way out. Maybe if I hand myself over and let them kill me, stuff me, and hang me over their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (ICILY) You'll do no such thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling, maybe they'll let everyone else live. Mrs. Fox stares at Fox. She says desolately:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Why'd you have to get us into this, Foxy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, but I have a possible theory. I think I have this thing where I need everybody to think I'm the greatest
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the quote-unquote fantastic Mr. Fox -- and if they aren't completely knocked- out, dazzled, and kind of intimidated by me, then I don't feel good about myself. Mrs. Fox shakes her head and turns away. Fox continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foxes traditionally like to court danger, hunt prey, and outsmart predators -- and that's what I'm actually good at! I think, at the end of the day, I'm just -- MRS. FOX (QUIETLY) We're wild animals. Fox smiles sadly and nods. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we always were. I promise you: if I had all this to do over again, I'd have never let you down. It was always more fun when we did it together, anyway. Mrs. Fox has tears all over her face. Fox kisses her. He whispers in her ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Felicity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX I love you, too, but I shouldn't have married you. Mrs. Fox turns and walks away. Fox stares after her. He goes over to Ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever tell you about the time I learned we were going to have a cub?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the fox-trap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. We were at gun-point, and your
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: says she's pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell it, OK? I had no idea how we were going to get out of this jam, and then it hit me: what do foxes do better than any other animal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're stepping on my lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep telling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we dug. And the whole time I put paw over paw, scooping dirt and pebbles with your mother digging like crazy beside me, I kept wondering: who is this little boy going to be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or girl, right -- because at that point we didn't know. Fox grabs Ash by his shoulders and looks him in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ash, I'm so glad he was you. Fox hugs Ash tightly, holds him for an instant, then let's go. He turns to the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badger, organize a search party and try to find Kristofferson. Maybe he's alive. I'm sorry, everyone. I wish -- (HESITATES) Well, good-bye. Fox looks across the cavern to Mrs. Fox standing with her back to him. She turns to face him. Her eyes are burning. Fox smiles sadly. He races away down the drain-pipe. Everyone watches him disappear. Badger hesitates. He addresses the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we should probably split into a certain number of groups and start doing something, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox sprints full-speed in the darkness. His claws scratch rattling along the iron floor and splash through puddles of shallow water. Fox stops suddenly. He stands up tall on his hind legs. His ears perk up. One pins back. He listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badger carrying a lantern leading Ash, Mole, and two small rabbits down a drainpipe. Badger calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson? Hello? Can you hear us? Rat's voice echoes in the darkness:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all lookin' for somethin'? Nothin' down here but rusty bottle-caps and drainin' water. Everyone stops short. Rat drops into the pipe from an overhead drain ahead of them. He says ominously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's got him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The farmers three. You know who I'm talkin' about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've kidnapped him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well-done, Mr. Badger. You're a smart man. They want to trade the son for his poppa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rat flicks a folded letter through the air. Badger catches it. He opens it. Kylie looks over his shoulder. Badger frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd they write this in letters cut out of magazines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To protect their identities. (on second thought) Oh, right, but then why'd they sign their names? Plus, we already knew who they were because they're trying to kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ransom note written in letters cut out of magazines and pasted onto a piece of paper. Badger reads out loud: Mr. Fox, we have your son. If you ever want to see him alive again -- Ash calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm his son. Everyone looks at Ash. He stands behind them in silhouette. Rat says darkly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see the resemblance. Pause. In an instant, Rat grabs Ash by the tail, picks him up off the ground, swings him in the air, and flings him away twenty feet down the drainpipe. Badger looks stunned. Ash sits in a puddle in a stupor. Rat races toward him down the tunnel. He leaps into the air with his claws out and his teeth bared. As he is about to seize upon Ash -- he is suddenly jerked backwards and spun around. Rat is face to face with Fox. Fox strikes his old-fashioned boxing stance. He draws back and throws a hard punch, nailing Rat square in the jaw. Rat staggers, stunned. He swings his switchblade, cutting Fox across the chest. Fox touches the wound and looks at the blood on the fingers of his paw. He looks to Rat. Rat holds up his wrist and shows Fox a child's plastic digital watch with miniature footballs, baseballs, and soccer balls on it. He says strangely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've still got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you just say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I've still got the watch, Mr. Fox. She never asked for it back. A frozen moment. Fox springs forward and clamps his jaws onto Rat's throat. Rat tumbles over backwards. Fox pins him to the ground with his teeth in Rat's neck. Rat kicks and bucks and struggles, but Fox holds him fast. Rat goes limp. Fox releases him. Everyone slowly gathers around Fox and Rat. Ash kneels next to his father. Fox cradles Rat in his arms. Rat whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy's locked in an apple crate on top of a gun-locker in the attic of Bean Annex. It's a set-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you have told me if I didn't kill you first? Rat smiles sickly. Blood drips from his mouth. His voice
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) All these wasted years. What were you looking for, Rat? Fox wipes the blood from Rat's chin. Rat mutters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trying to say something, Dad. Fox leans his ear close to Rat's mouth. As quiet as a mouse,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox nods. He looks around the drainpipe. He cups his paw into the pool of murky water and holds it to Rat's lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here you are, Rat. A beaker of Bean's finest secret cider. Rat's slivery, scratchity, long, pink tongue laps up a taste of the black liquid. He licks his lips and says faintly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like melted gold. Rat's eyes turn into X's. He is dead. Ash stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He redeemed himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Redemption? Sure. Fox swallows and says hopelessly with tears in his eyes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, in the end -- he's just another dead rat in a garbage pail behind a Chinese restaurant. Ash puts his hand on Fox's shoulder. Fox lays Rat gently onto the sewer floor. He stands up and turns to the rest of the group. Badger claps his paws together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I suppose we should -- FOX (INTERRUPTING) Excuse me, again, B. The search party's been cancelled. We're replacing it with a go-for-broke rescue mission. It's a set- up, but maybe we can make it work. You two little rabbits run tell the others. (YELLING) Now, go! The two little rabbits scurry away down the drainpipe. Badger walks with Fox and Ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was he saying about that wristwatch? I didn't get what he was talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox hesitates. He shrugs and says with a sad nostalgia:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just some old back-story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The entire community of animals has reconnoitered in the brick cavern. Fox stands on a large spigot and addresses the group. He has a bandage on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a way, I'm almost glad that flood interrupted us, because I don't like the toast I was giving. I'm going to start over. Fox pantomimes raising a long-stemmed glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I look down this table with the exquisite feast set before us, I see: two terrific lawyers, a skilled pediatrician, a wonderful chef, a savvy real-estate agent, an excellent tailor, a crack accountant, a gifted musician, a pretty good minnow fisherman, and possibly the best landscape painter working on the scene today. As Fox describes them, the shot cuts to: Badger and Beaver; Mrs. Badger; Rabbit; Weasel; an especially small, waifish field mouse; Mole; Kylie (who looks slightly offended); and Mrs. Fox, respectively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe a few of you might even read my column from time to time. Who knows? I tend to doubt it. (DRAMATIC PAUSE) I also see a room full of wild animals. Everyone stares at Fox curiously, skeptical but intrigued. Fox points at them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wild animals with true natures and pure talents. Wild animals with scientific- sounding Latin names that mean something about our D.N.A. Wild animals each with his own strengths and weaknesses due to his or her species, and also -- well, I guess these things usually have a lot to (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: do with the parents, as we all know. Anyway, I think it may very well be all the beautiful differences among us that just might give us the tiniest glimmer of a chance of saving my nephew and letting me make it up to you for getting us into this crazy whatever-it-is. I don't know. It's just a thought. Thank you for listening. Cheers, everyone. Fox motions with his imaginary glass and pantomimes drinking it. A few of the others reluctantly pantomime drinking. Fox finishes his glass and pantomimes throwing it on the floor. He makes a smashing-glass sound. Kylie shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's eat! Everyone turns to Kylie uncertainly. Kylie hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I'm just playing along with the -- FOX (FORCEFULLY) All right! Let's start planning! Who knows shorthand? Pause. Badger points to his otter secretary. She is Linda. Fox darts over to her and grips her by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda! Lutra Lutra! You got some dry paper? Here we go! Fox, highly energized, moves among the group, touching their shoulders and patting their backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mole! Talpa Europea! What do you got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see in the dark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's incredible! We can use that! Linda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit! Oryctolagus Cuniculus!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet your cuss you are! Linda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beaver! Castor Fiber!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can chew through wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amazing! Linda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badger! Meles Meles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demolitions expert!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Since when?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Explosions, flames, things that burn!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demolitions expert! OK! Linda!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it! Fox's cheeks and forehead are beaded with perspiration. He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weasel! Mustela Nivalis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop yelling! Fox snaps his fingers, kicks a rock, and throws his arm into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! Fox points to the various cubs and pups.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you little kids get organized and put together some kind of a K.P. unit or something to keep this sewer clean. It's good for morale. The field mouse shoves his way to the front of the crowd. He makes a fist with his paw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to go with you, too! I want to fight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Fabulous! Microtus Pennsylvanicus! Do you do that, in fact? Are field mice violent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not particularly, except maybe domestic/ kitchen sink-type stuff, but I have a hunch I might just -- (DEVIL-MAY-CARE) -- land a few good punches before I get stepped on, poisoned, or lured to my death by a little piece of cheese. Who's to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling with admiration) You're a cuss of a lot bigger than you look, Rickity. Kylie tugs at Fox's sleeve. Fox turns to look at him. Kylie
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't get a job yet -- or a Latin name. What's my strength? Fox raises an eyebrow. He thinks of something:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, you're Kylie. You're an unbelievably nice guy. Your job is really just to... be available, I think. I don't know your Latin name. I doubt they even had opossums in ancient Rome. Kylie puts his hands in his pockets and scowls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Mrs. Fox puts the finishing touches on a vast mural painted on the longest, tallest wall of the brick cavern. She stands on a ladder. Her sleeves are rolled up, and she is splattered with twelve different colors of paint. She looks down to Fox standing below with an entourage of Kylie, Badger, Linda, and Rickity. The animal children mop and scrub in the background. Ash stands leaning against a push-broom watching his parents. Fox surveys the mural. It is highly detailed, filled with the textures of the landscape, and decorated with images of flowers, leaves, acorns, etc. It is signed Felicity Fox. Fox opens his arms wide and shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's stupendous. Where's us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (pointing to a spot) Right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paint an X.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bottom of the map. Mrs. Fox's paw paints a red X and puts a circle around it. The shot zooms out to reveal the entire valley -- no longer a painting on the brick wall. Lighting strikes at the horizon. Dark clouds loom over the three farmers' compounds. It looks exactly like one of Mrs. Fox's paintings of a landscape in a rainstorm. Bean's helicopter circles the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A bicycle messenger with a head-lamp rings his bell as he approaches the farmers' camp. He stops in front of Bean and hands him an envelope. Bean tears it open and unfolds the letter inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A note written in letters cut out of magazines and pasted onto a piece of paper. It reads: Dear Farmers Boggis, Bunce, and Bean, I have no alternative but to agree to your terms. Move the station wagon and open the manhole cover below the foot of the drainpipe next to the cobbler's shop and meet me there today at 10 A.M. sharp. I will hand myself over to you in exchange for the boy's safe return. Cordially, Mr. Fox Bean frowns. He studies the letter. He shows it to Boggis and Bunce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd he write this in letters cut out of magazines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, but you did the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't trust this guy. Anyway, set up the ambush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The top floor of Bean Annex. The room is filled with boxes of Christmas ornaments, old sports equipment, two stained mattresses, and a broken birdcage. Cobwebs hang from the rafters below the sloped roof. Kristofferson stands with his hands in his pockets looking out between the slats from inside a padlocked apple crate on top of a gun locker in the corner. He clears his throat. He calls out politely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I have a cup of water, please? Kristofferson waits for a reply, but no one answers. He whistles to himself for a minute. He clears his throat again. He calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me! Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A cement conduit with an iron grating above it. A fast stream of sewer water runs along its side. Fox walks briskly down the pipe followed by his entourage and Ash. Their steps echo loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Synchronize your clocks. The time is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox looks at his wrist. He is wearing Rat's plastic, digital, sports-themed wristwatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nine forty-five A.M. Everyone checks their watches. Badger points at Fox's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that Rat's watch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Originally, no. (PAUSE) Well, OK, here's the back-story: when I was a teenager I spent a summer working as a bar-back at a jazz pub called Django's where Rat played horn down near -- can I tell this another time? We should stay focused on what's happening right now. Ash comes up to Fox's side and says discreetly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should probably ride with you and Kylie since it's my fault Kristofferson got captured stealing those nutmeg-ginger- apple snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't understand a word of that sentence, but none of it matters, anyway, because it's too dangerous for you to come with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY An old craftsman looks out from the window of Ferguson Cobblers as he taps little nails into the heel of a loafer. A station-wagon with wood-grain side-panels and a flat tire sits parked on a manhole cover in front of the shop. Boggis, Bunce, and five armed farmhands watch as Bean monkeys with a slim-jim until he gets the car door jimmied. Bean hops inside. He starts the engine, puts his arm over the top of the seat as he looks back out the rear window, and throws the station-wagon into reverse. The farmers clear out of the way as Bean backs up off the manhole cover. Boggis and Bunce stick tools into the manhole cover and lift it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rat's watch. It is now 10 A.M.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six armed farmhands on the roof of the Nag's Head Tavern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven armed farmhands in the bushes behind Sweetings Bakery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight armed farmers in the window of Harrison Travel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Action 13 reporter and camera crew in an alley next to St. John's Coin-op Laundry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Boggis, Bunce, and Bean crouch behind the open doors of a pick-up truck with three beagles. Boggis checks his carbine. Bunce loads his shotgun. Bean cocks his Luger. Fox's voice hollers from deep inside the manhole:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Did you bring the boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, we did! Say something, kid! Bunce presses play on a tape recorder. Kristofferson's voice comes over a loudspeaker:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me! Excuse me? Bunce presses stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and his entourage at the bottom off the manhole. Fox scoffs. He smiles and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! That doesn't sound anything like him! It's amateur night in Dixie! Badger rapidly slaps two pieces of flint together. A bit chips off, and sparks fly from the break. He blows on some kindling. He takes a pinecone out of a basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A ribbon of white smoke rises out of the manhole. The three farmers watch curiously as it thickens and turns black. Bean frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the cuss is he burning? A blazing pinecone shoots out of the manhole and flies through the air, over the farmers' heads. It lands in a trash can and lights some rubbish on fire. A man with a dart in one hand and a mug of ale in the other comes out of the Nag's Head and pours his beer into the trash can. The fire goes out. The three farmers laugh smugly. Bean shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all you've got, Mr. Fox? Twenty-seven blazing pinecones shoot out of the manhole and hit: a wood-pile on the roof of the Nag's Head, a box of pastry wrappers in the bushes behind Sweetings, a stack of brochures in the window of Harrison Travel, a hay bale in the bed of the pick-up truck, Boggis, Bunce, Bean, and a crate of cam-corder batteries next to the Action 13 camera crew, which explodes. Farmers scatter, grabbing hoses, yelling, and tamping out the flames as the beagles bark, yelp, and scramble in the confusion. Rabbit darts out of the hole and races up the street. Six farmers chase after him, firing their weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Down in the brick cavern, Mole listens to a tin can attached to a string. He says urgently as he makes notations in a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-eight pinecones fired! Twenty-two targets hit! Mrs. Fox, standing on her ladder, paints black checks quickly on the street in her mural. The stolen, portable television set sits in the corner, tuned into Action 13's coverage of the chaos in the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit running full-steam out of the village being pursued by the six farmhands. He hurdles an empty Coke bottle lying on its side in the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Badger jumps out of the manhole and throws more blazing pinecones at farmers, trucks, parked cars, doors, windows, and the Action 13 camera crew. Seven farmhands chase him down a cobblestone lane. Weasel and Beaver climb out with straws in their paws and start firing blueberries toward the disoriented beagles. The beagles eat blueberries. They fall over. Eight farmhands chase Weasel and Beaver up a wooded path. Rickity, the field mouse, bounds out of the hole and leaps into the fracas. He fires a rubber band at Bunce off a paperclip. It snaps Bunce in the corner of his eye. Rickity lets out a little whoop. There is a small explosion and a burst of flames blasts from the manhole. Fox and Kylie jump out and run over to a vehicle with a tarp over it parked in front of Paddington Automotive. Fox whips off the tarp, revealing a miniature motorcycle with a sidecar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox driving the motorcycle with Kylie in the sidecar. They both wear helmets and goggles. Thunder rumbles in the distance. Kylie sinks lower in the sidecar. He shouts to Fox over the sound of the motor:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you scared of wolves?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scared, no! I have a phobia of them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have a thing about thunder!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? That's stupid! Ash pokes his head up from the rear compartment of the sidecar. He also wears a helmet and goggles. His white cape flutters behind him. He shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like needles! Fox and Kylie look to Ash in disbelief. Fox says furiously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you come from again? How'd you get in the sidecar? I feel like I'm losing my mind! Fox angrily steers toward a small mound of dirt. They jump it slightly and fly over a little ditch. Ash yelps enthusiastically as Fox drives them back onto the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A pilot with a red moustache and a South African accent flies Bean's chopper. He wears a Bean, inc. patch on his shoulder. He shouts into the microphone connected to his helmet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a fox on a motorcycle with a littler fox and what looks to be an opossum in the sidecar riding north on farm lane seven. Does that sound like anything to anybody? A military-type voice responds over the radio:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Roger that, Red. Let me just, uh -- Oh, I think the boss wants to -- BEAN (0.S.) Red, it's Franklin Bean! Turn around, get the cuss back here, and pick us up on the A.S.A.P!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The Bean, inc. windmill spins briskly in the dusty winds. Shutters on the farmhouse bang open and shut. Leaves rustle on the branches of the apple trees. A few stray turkeys wander in the yard. A white-washed brick pile six stories tall sits apart from the other structures. The doors to its courtyard are made of iron and painted yellow. This is Bean Annex. The front gates of the farm are open, and a gardener waters vegetables next to the driveway. Fox, Kylie, and Ash look out from a high branch over a reinforced concrete and barbed-wire security barricade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the annex over there on the right. Ash nods. Kylie does not respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The white building over there on the right. Pause. Fox looks to Kylie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kylie? Kylie turns to Fox and stares at him vacantly. Fox says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kylie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (SUDDENLY) I did it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When? I didn't see it! Kylie makes his slight gesture with his paw. The gardener puts three turnips into a basket and rides away on his bicycle. Fox, Kylie, and Ash scramble down the tree trunk. They come out of the bushes on their motorcycle and ride through the gates, across the yard, past the wandering turkeys. They park outside the courtyard doors to Bean Annex and jump off the motorcycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox climbs onto Kylie's shoulders and tries the knobs. They are locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kylie, you got a credit card?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (digging in his pockets) Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, this is what I was saying about how good you are at just being available for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kylie hands Fox a World Traveler Titanium Card. Fox frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Titanium Card? How the cuss did you qualify for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pay my bills on time. I've always had good credit. Fox examines the card with mild resentment. He picks the lock and opens the doors. The courtyard has high walls and a gravel floor. On one side, there are ten trash cans, a stack of newspapers, and a compost heap. On the other side, there is an old, rusted, broken-down tractor and a new one. By far the largest, fattest, toughest beagle yet lies sleeping in the middle. White foam froths around its mouth as it breathes heavily. Its collar is hooked to a thick chain. A tag around its neck reads Spitz. Fox, Kylie, and Ash stop in their tracks. The beagle opens his eyes. Fox turns to Kylie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a blueberry. Kylie looks surprised. He shrugs. He shakes his head and gestures, I don't have any. Fox frowns. He throws up his hands in the air. Kylie makes a frustrated face. Fox points at him. Kylie looks away and snorts angrily. Fox looks away and spits at the ground. Ash says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that white stuff around his mouth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he eats soap. Fox sees an amber, plastic pharmacy bottle on a shelf above some bags of fertilizer. It's reads: Drug: Phenomoxylcarbobubytol, 10 mg
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For: RABIES (chronic) Other: Take with meat, do not operate heavy machinery Fox frowns. He says grimly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not soap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then why does he have that bubbly -- FOX He's rabid. With rabies. I've heard about this beagle. The beagle stands up. Fox says carefully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, boy. Fox takes a cautious step toward the beagle. He holds out the back of his paw for the beagle to sniff. He says back over his shoulder to Kylie and Ash:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to try to befriend him. I feel like there's a tenderness in his eyes. Fox takes another step. He makes a soft, kissing noise. The beagle watches him calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm right. He's a good boy. A little lonely, maybe, but -- Fox takes another cautious step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but terribly sweet. Hello, there, boy. Is your name Spitz? That's German, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside, to Ash) I thought he said you never look a beagle in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, you're just as sweet as a -- Fox and the beagle lock eyes. The pupils of the beagle's eyes contract then completely disappear, and the whites turn bright red. Fox's eyes open wider than their sockets. The rabid beagle erupts ballistically, attacking like an enraged maniac. His chain rips out of the cement. Fox, Kylie, and Ash shriek and scream, sprinting frantically around the courtyard as the rabid beagle, frothing, roaring, and snapping, tries desperately to kill them. Fox shouts, his voice cracking like a grandmother's:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climb the trellis! In well under a second, Fox, Kylie, and Ash scale the trellis six stories -- Kylie's pants catching on a nail and ripping off on the way up -- and find themselves standing on the roof of Bean Annex. Kylie wears blue Fruit-of-the-Looms with a pattern of stars, moons, and planets on them. They all look down at the rabid beagle, which continues to pitch an insane fit, running in circles after its tail at the bottom of the courtyard. Fox takes in their new surroundings. He says, pleased:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the attic is probably in the area right up around here somewhere, I figure, huh? Kylie and Ash, panting and dripping with sweat, both stare at Fox vacantly. (NOTE: a second set of alternate eyeballs indicating Kylie's vacant look will be used for Ash in this shot.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, guys. Stay with me. We did good. That's just some dog. Let's not get traumatized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bean's helicopter lands on top of the Nag's Head. Fires smolder and farmers continue to chase around after animals in the village streets below. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean, leaning over and holding onto their hats, run to the chopper and climb inside. They take off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The street below. An orange and yellow Citroen van screeches into the melee. Painted yellow letters spell Badoit et Fils, Destruction des Animaux Nuisibles on the side of it with an image of a trapped fox. An old man with a grey moustache and a young man with a black moustache, both dressed in orange-and-yellow-striped uniforms, jump out of the van. They open the side door and start unloading stacks of metal cages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit still running full-steam down a country lane being pursued by the six farmhands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Kristofferson stands inside the apple crate leaning against the wall with his legs crossed and one arm akimbo with his hand on his hip. There is a clanking sound from above. Kristofferson looks up. A trap door in the ceiling creaks open. Fox, Kylie, and Ash look inside, down at Kristofferson. Kristofferson smiles oddly and says in a surprised, fancy-meeting-you-here voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox and Kylie lowering Ash into the room with three different- colored shoelaces tied together and belted around his waist. Ash holds the shoelace and keeps a paw behind his back like a mountaineer. His feet touch down on the shelf. He runs to the apple crate and jiggles the padlock. He hesitates. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get one of those karate lessons real quick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK. Normally, we start with some breathing exercises and such. Stand like this. Kristofferson stands with his paws clasped in front of him. Ash mimics this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fox-trap hanging from a chain suspended above the alley behind the Nag's Head Tavern. A second one hangs behind Sweetings Bakery. A third one hangs behind Harrison Travel. A fourth one hangs behind St. John's Coin-op Laundry. A fifth one hangs behind Ferguson Cobblers. Rickity curiously examines a little, hanging wire. He mutters
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this spring-loaded?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson continuing Ash's karate lesson:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This next part is mental. Position yourself on the balls of your feet. Kristofferson stands lightly poised with his arms out. Ash mimics this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close your eyes. Kristofferson closes his eyes. So does Ash. So do Fox and Kylie. Kristofferson says mystically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weigh less than a slice of bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Each fox-trap in rapid succession as it falls on: Rickity, Badger, Weasel, and Beaver. The two small rabbits watch from a sewer-gutter drain under the street-curb. They panic. They race down a pipe, into a tunnel, and through a conduit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson continuing Ash's karate lesson:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's review the principle agility techniques: jumping, flipping, landing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Fox looking down from her ladder at the three, panting rabbits. She looks stunned. She motions to her mural/map and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Show me where they are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two small rabbits, Mrs. Rabbit, Mrs. Badger, Mole, and Mrs. Fox each furiously digging a new tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Now for a rudimentary version of the cyclone chop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristofferson continuing Ash's karate lesson:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First, you need to get a running start, which, obviously, I can't do in here, then, as you arrive at the destination of the chop -- (DEMONSTRATING) -- lean and thrust into the point of contact, paw remains open and straight, then withdraw instantaneously. Remember, it's the pull-back that matters. The pull-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- generates the force of the impact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it. Ash walks ten paces away to the far end of the shelf. Fox and Kylie watch from above. Kylie says excitedly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to do it! Fox makes a face that says, I'm not so sure. Ash takes a deep breath. He screams at the top of his lungs as he sprints toward the apple crate:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ki-ya! Ash's toe catches on a loose nail. He somersaults twice through the air and bounces off the side of the apple crate, which falls off the shelf. Kristofferson braces himself. The apple crate hits the floor and shatters into pieces. Kristofferson lies among the wreckage. Ash looks over the side of the shelf. Fox and Kylie watch from above, grimacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right. You were just trying to unlock the apple crate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I mean I'm sorry about -- KRISTOFFERSON (picking himself up) Oh, you mean from before. The apology you owed me which you never actually said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Kristofferson nods sadly. He takes a deep breath. He nods again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right, too. Throw me the shoelace, please. Ash smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badger trapped in his cage. He hears something. He looks quickly down the alley. The old, orange van turns the corner and approaches, bumping over potholes. Badger shrinks into the corner of the cage and mutters grimly to himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badoit et fils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A cobblestone beside Badger suddenly drops straight down and disappears into the ground. Badger recoils, scared and confused. Mrs. Fox pokes her head up through the hole. She is beaded with perspiration and breathes heavily. Her fur is wildly dishevelled. She looks to the van driving up the alley. She looks to Badger. She extends her paw to him and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson come around the side of the building. They run to their motorcycle, outside the courtyard doors. They freeze. The front gates to the compound are closed and bolted. Bean's helicopter waits on top of the vegetable garden with its rotar-blades whirling. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean stand in front of Bean Annex with their weapons drawn. Fox sees his tail around Bean's collar. His eyes narrow. His jaw sets. He says to himself with growing emotion:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your tractors uprooted my tree. Your posse hunted my family. Your gunmen kidnapped my nephew. Your rat insulted my wife -- and you shot off my tail. (STEELY) I'm not leaving here without that neck- tie. Bean smiles his sickly smile. Fox smiles back defiantly. Kylie looks utterly baffled. Ash says mystically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I weigh less than a slice of bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right back. Ash runs. Fox, Kylie, and Kristofferson watch, shocked, as Ash sprints back to the courtyard doors. The three farmers open fire at him. Fox, Kylie, and Kristofferson duck and take cover behind a hay-bale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ash dodges bullets. He jumps off the balls of his feet with his arms out over a sprinkler-pipe and swings like a gymnast onto a clothesline, then flies through the air doing another of his spectacularly awkward four-armed and three-legged back- flips. He lands on the handle of one of the courtyard doors
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ki-ya! Ash cyclone-chops the doorknob. The lock clicks. Ash's eyes light up. Ash drops to the ground. He digs a hole and burrows into the dirt as bullets fly everywhere. He breathes in through his nose and out through his mouth. Fox watches with his jaw hanging open. The courtyard doors smash apart and the rabid beagle tears out into the vegetable garden growling, foaming, and thrashing crazily. The farmers shriek and scream and run around, panicking, with their guns blazing. Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson jump onto their motorcycle. The beagle rips the tail from Bean's neck, shreds it, chews it up, and swallows it. Fox deflates for an instant, then recovers. He looks to Ash on the back of the motorcycle, behind him, with his hands around Fox's waist. He says with the deepest affection and respect:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ash, that was pure, wild animal craziness. You're an athlete. Ash swallows. He beams. He sits up straighter. (NOTE: from this point onwards, an alternate version of Ash will be used which is slightly taller, slightly leaner, and animated slightly more gracefully.) Fox kick-starts the motorcycle and races across the farm. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean scramble onto the roof of a car port with an old, white Mercedes convertible under it. The snarling beagle barks and snaps below them. They watch as: Fox steers the motorcycle toward a broken apple cart at the edge of the property. He guns the motor and yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy swearing cuss!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox races the motorcycle up the apple cart, into the air, and over the concrete barricade. They land in the middle of the road, skidding, and speed off down the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boggis, Bunce, and Bean watching from the roof of the car port. Boggis turns to Bean and says, deadpan, needling him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Franklin? You got any final twist for this plot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Bean grabs Boggis by the neck and throttles him. Bunce starts throwing punches. Bean holds him back by the forehead. Boggis kicks Bunce in the stomach. They brawl chaotically while the rabid beagle continues to go bananas below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Each fox-trap with a cobblestone missing underneath it and a hole in the ground. The old man with the grey moustache turns to his son and says with a strong French accent:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Mrs. Fox sits anxiously at the bottom of her ladder. Badger, Weasel, Rickity, the two small rabbits, and the others sit, exhausted, in the dark cavern, passing a jar of cider. Mole
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand by! Everyone looks to Mole. Mole is holding the tin can with the string attached to it to his ear. He nods and says urgently:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just intercepted a high-frequency radio signal with the can -- (gestures with the tin can)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and I think they're on their way home!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mrs. Fox jumps up, embraces Mole, and kisses him on the snout. Mole blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit still running full-steam back into the village being pursued by the six farmhands. He comes to the manhole where they started and darts into it. The six farmhands stop at the manhole and look down. They go straight to the Nag's Head, walk inside, and close the door behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson ride down a country road. Kylie sees something across the meadow. He says warily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't turn around!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Fox turns around. A huge, wild, grey wolf with ice-blue eyes stands on a rock fifty feet away from them. Fox slams on the brakes. The motorcycle slides to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd he come from? (LOUDLY) Where'd you come from? What are you doing here? Pause. Fox points toward the wolf:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canis lupus! Fox points to himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vulpes Vulpes! The wolf does not answer. Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson watch idling from the motorcycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think he speaks English or Latin. (LOUDLY) Pensez-vous que 1'hiver sera rude? (ASIDE) I'm asking if he thinks we're in for a hard winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The wolf shakes his head. Fox nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't seem to know. Silence. Fox shouts to the wolf with a strange hitch in his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a phobia of wolves! The wolf does not answer. It breathes heavily with its mouth open. Its teeth are long, sharp, and yellow. Its tongue hangs out, and its eyes are wild. Fox looks back at it with the identical expression for a minute, mesmerized -- then Fox closes his mouth and his eyes soften. Fox raises his paw in the air. The wolf blinks a few times. It raises its paw in the air. It turns away and trots off into the woods. Fox says wistfully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a beautiful creature. Wish him luck, boys. Fox guns the motor. Gravel spits from under the spinning tires, and they tear off down the road. The shot booms down into the ground, below the grass, through buried pebbles, layers of soil, and subterranean mineral deposits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (2 1/2 Fox Weeks) The shot continues to descend past Badger and his family having dinner in a nicely furnished drain-pipe, past Rabbit and his family watching Magnum, P.I. on the stolen, portable television set in a well-appointed cement tunnel, past Beaver and Mrs. Beaver hosting Mole and Weasel for cocktails in a tasteful sewer-conduit. The shot stops in a small chamber adjacent to the brick cavern. The walls are filled with electrical cables, wires, pipes, and a large, new mural which depicts the Fox's former view of the valley as seen from their tree with a trompe
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: oeil window-frame around it. It is signed Felicity Fox. Ash and Kristofferson sit Indian-style meditating on a braided rug. Mrs. Fox works mixing paints and turpentine at an easel in the corner. There is an armchair with a folded-up copy of the Gazette on its cushion in the center of the room under a glowing lamp. Classical music plays on a radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fox swings his head into the room from a tunnel. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My darlings? Everyone looks to Fox. He signals them to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The cement conduit with the iron grating above it. Fox and his family walk briskly down the pipe. A knitted, woolen, artificial tail has been sewn into the seat of Fox's trousers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were in the middle of a meditation practice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch your step. Fox takes everyone through an opening and starts climbing a metal ladder. He says theatrically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see, now. Where does this lead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Oh, no, Foxy. It's filthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep a good grip, everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This better be worth it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I see a little sliver of light. What's this? Is that a door?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You're a terrible actor, Foxy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you smell something? Is that -- (SNIFFS TWICE) -- freon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. I'm going to crack open this trap door and see if something's on the other side. I highly doubt it, though. There's probably just more sewer. Fox clears his throat. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, wouldn't it be surprising if -- ASH Open it. Fox pushes open the trap door and crawls out. Everyone follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Fox and his family stand in the middle of an aisle at the center of a large grocery store. To their left is the refrigerated section of milk, eggs, meat, fish, and cheese. To their right are canned goods, breakfast cereal, laundry detergent, rice, pasta, and condiments. The lights are half- dimmed, and a metal grate is closed over the front windows. There are no people. Fox says casually:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look! There's a whole, enormous, glorious, gigantic supermarket up here! Ash and Kristofferson seem dumbstruck. Fox raises an eyebrow and smiles at Mrs. Fox. She puts her arm around his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX You really are kind of a quote-unquote fantastic fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try. I guess now that Kristofferson's dad's already down to single-pneumonia and getting better, he'll be going home soon, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX Actually, when he spoke to me from the hospital, he said he was already talking (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX (cont'd) to Weasel about real-estate availabil- ities down in our sewer system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really? Well, now's the time to buy. Kylie comes around the end of the aisle pushing a miniature shopping cart filled with jars of jelly, jam, olives, pickles, and honey, plus three loaves of bread, Band-Aids, toothpaste, and a carton of strawberry ice cream. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I hear my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not down here, you didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we were talking about other things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well. Fox looks at Ash, who is studying a twelve-pack of tropical juice punch-boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The white cape rather suits him, doesn't it? Actually, I had to do quite a bit of searching myself before I found a look that really flattered me. Remember those horseshoe cuff-links? Fox and Mrs. Fox crack-up laughing. Fox notices something and stops. He stares at Mrs. Fox strangely. She is glowing. She hesitates. She shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOX I'm pregnant again. Fox is confused and moved. He holds Mrs. Fox's face in his paws. She smiles. Ash interrupts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad?
direction.name: direction
